messages.title: The Conservative Party's Approach to Immigration
messages.content: With less than two weeks to go before the general election, I think there is a real choice on offer. In no area is that more true than immigration.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Policies will ensure that net immigration is reduced to the levels of the 1990s – tens of thousands a year, instead of the hundreds of thousands a year under Labour.

issues.economy: highlighting that only people able to contribute to the economy through work will be eligible for entry
issues.immigration: Proposing an annual limit on non-EU immigrants, and measures to prevent abuse of the student visa system, as well as proposing a new border police force to manage immigration effectively.

leaflet.personalStatement: I hope you will take the chance to vote for change on 6 May.

contactInformation.address: Conservative Campaign Headquarters, 30 Millbank, London SW1P 4DP

images.caption: Leaflet featuring the message from David Cameron, Leader of the Conservative Party, regarding the party's approach to immigration.
